channel.title: Topics on PHI 162
channel.description: Recent content in Topics on PHI 162

item.title: Topic 2: Darwin and Natural Selection
item.description: Reading Darwin, Charles. 1859. The Origin of Species. First edition (of 6). Read Chapter 3. Then, read just up to page 10 in Chapter 4, and finally the final paragraph of Chapter 14 (on the last page). Available via Blackboard. Waters, C. Kenneth. 2003. “The Arguments in the Origin of Species.” In The Cambridge Companion to Darwin, edited by Gregory Radick and Jonathan Hodge, 116–139. Cambridge University Press. via Blackboard.

item.title: Topic 1: Before Natural Selection
item.description: Reading Aristotle, excerpts from Physics and Parts of Animals (about 350 BCE). Handout. Available through Blackboard > Course Documents. Note: This is short but dense. Try to work through it carefully; see the reading questions below ↓. William Smellie, “Of the Progressive Scale or Chain of Beings in the Universe” (1791). Available through Blackboard > Course Documents. Note: This is an account of the relationships among all living things from the perspective of late-eighteenth century biology in England.
